meanings.definition: To cause to lose balance or stability.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind overbalances the delicate flower.
meanings.sent2: The heavy box overbalances the small child.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten overbalances the tower of blocks.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overbalances her ability to stay calm.
meanings.sent5: The slippery floor overbalances the clumsy dancer.

meanings.definition: To be more than enough for; exceed.
meanings.sent1: The generous portion of food overbalances his appetite.
meanings.sent2: The extra weight of the luggage overbalances the limit for the flight.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing cup of water overbalances the tiny saucer.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm overbalances his experience in this matter.
meanings.sent5: The loud music overbalances the peaceful atmosphere of the room.

meanings.sent1: The benefits of exercise overbalance the effort required.
meanings.sent2: The advantages of the new technology overbalance the initial cost.
meanings.sent3: The joy of the moment overbalances the worries of tomorrow.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness overbalances any flaws she may have.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset overbalances the challenges of the day.
